subject: Nutrition
title: Food and Mood
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Food and Mood.

hook.text: People eating mostly processed food are 60% more likely to develop depression. Diet shapes your mind.

buildup.text: Serotonin, the mood neurotransmitter, is 95% produced in the gutâ€”not the brain.

discovery.text: Omega-3 fats, B vitamins, and magnesium directly support neurotransmitter production and emotional balance.

twist.text: A junk food diet measurably impairs your brain's ability to regulate emotions, beyond just fatigue.

climax.text: Clinical trials show improved diet reduces depression symptoms comparable to therapy in mild cases.

punchline.text: What you eat shapes how you feel, not just physically.
